column1: Just wondering what peoples expectations are of when it will be likely for Holidays to be allowed to the regions of koh Pha Ngan,Samui & Phuket from the UK ?

Honestly, your guess is as good as the next persons.No one had any idea when international commercial flights will start up again, and what countries may or may not be excluded, so actually try and put a date on when travel from the UK will be allowed is rather pointless at the time being.
Yes I agree. I was mainly trying to get a local view if honest but didnt explain that in my original post.

Over recent days and weeks one or two regulars have posted at length on this subject outlining in considerable detail their views on how and when Thailand will reopen to foreign visitors. However it has all been speculation, educated guesswork - call it what you will. Those in charge in Thailand make the decisions. At the moment the authorities are anti foreigners as evidenced by simple things like the opening of Wat Pho to Thais only - foreigners specifically banned. The reason given is to prevent Covid19 infection. Also I believe that (some) inter city buses are not currently allowing foreigners on board.We can only wait and see.

Yes I saw that non Thai's not allowed on the government buses. Ian posted on Facebook they were not allowed on the Bangkok to Trat route. Also saw Korat not allowing non Thai ex pats on some of their buses.Hard to tell when the Brits will be allowed back in Thailand but assume due to having one of the biggest death rates in the world we will be one of the last countries.Heard someone talking on one of the forums say that China and Vietnam will be the first tourists allowed in I've already given up hope of November and highly doubt my planned trip January/February 2021 will go ahead. Certainly wont be booking or planning anything until autumn. Some of my neighbours and teacher colleagues who have already booked family trips planned to Spain and the med in school holidays starting next month may be in for a disappointment. The Brits will find it hard going anywhere for a while yet. It's a case of watch this space July/August see if Brits can go to Europe easily. Then hopefully later in the year things will open for far east Asia.Edited: 8:27 pm, June 11, 2020
